Note: Participant described images sent in WhatsApp as unidentifiable blobs when viewing them in glasses. Pt had to exit chat and then re-enter to allow images to load clearly
Participant sent an image to a contact in WhatsApp using the share icon in the glasses gallery app but was unaware that image had actually been sent
Participant says they heard a whoosh noise as if the image was sent but did not receive any verbal or visual confirmation which confused them
Participant describes screen clarity as “horrible” in the sun
Participant says that in the shade, it’s much better but busy backdrops are distracting. Looking at bright objects lessens screen clarity as if brightness has been turned down
Participant says they experience a disorienting feeling as their left eye is working to also view the screen despite it not existing in the left lens
Participant often accidentally takes multiple photos at once because they’re not sure if they’ve actually taken a photo
Participant expresses desire to zoom in on pictures that have been received in WhatsApp
Participant notices discrepancies in colors seen in images vs whats perceived in front of them but says it’s not a significant difference. For example, shades of green appear darker in the image
Participant says they’d rather have the instruction booklet in front of them instead of viewing Lego instructions on images sent in WhatsApp
Participant looking away and toward the floor to use as a solid background so that images appear more clearly
Participant inclined to close left eye because they are able to perceive finer detail and compares this inclination to the natural reaction of someone squinting when the sun hits them
Participant generally content with neural band’s ability to register hand gestures but does notice they sometimes have to perform them more than once
Participant notices that they have been simply sending the image they’ve just captured using the “send” button but says they’re not aware who it’s going to because the screen does not clarify
Normal text in images sent in WhatsApp is generally legible but participant does say that some of the smaller text is difficult to see
